856.question: What baseline did they compare Entity-GCN to?

6-Table2-1.png: They compared Entity-GCN to the baseline of 'Human' as mentioned in the table.</s>
They compared Entity-GCN to the baseline of 'Human' as mentioned in the table.</s>

856.answer: Human, FastQA, BiDAF, Coref-GRU, MHPGM, Weaver / Jenga, MHQA-GRN

858.question: Did they use a relation extraction method to construct the edges in the graph?

3-Figure2-1.png: Yes, they used a relation extraction method to construct the edges in the graph.</s>

Yes, they used a relation extraction method to construct the edges in the graph. This is indicated by the caption which mentions 'relation extraction method' and the three types of relations used in the graph.</s>

859.question: How did they get relations between mentions?

3-Figure2-1.png: They got relations between mentions by analyzing the support documents.</s>
They got relations between mentions by analyzing the supporting documents. They organized these documents as a graph and used three simple relations to determine the connections between mentions.</s>

859.answer: Assign a value to the relation based on whether mentions occur in the same document, if mentions are identical, or if mentions are in the same coreference chain.

862.question: What performance does the Entity-GCN get on WIKIHOP?

6-Table2-1.png: The Entity-GCN achieves an accuracy of 71.6 on the WIKIHOP closed test set and 71.6 on the public validation set.</s>
The Entity-GCN achieves an accuracy of 71.6 on the WIKIHOP closed test set and 71.6 on the public validation set.</s>

862.answer: During testing: 67.6 for single model without coreference, 66.4 for single model with coreference, 71.2 for ensemble of 5 models
